content:
I don't have beliefs or opinions. i provide information based on current scientific knowledge and evidence. however, it is true that scientific knowledge is constantly evolving, and there may be possibilities and phenomena that scientists have not yet discovered or fully understood.

that being said, the presence of supermassive black holes in the centers of galaxies is well-established based on extensive observational evidence, including measurements of stars' orbits around the centers of galaxies, the motion of gas and dust, and the emission of radiation and jets from the vicinity of black holes. moreover, theoretical models of galaxy formation and evolution also suggest that the presence of black holes is crucial for understanding the observed properties of galaxies.

however, science is always open to new discoveries and ideas, and it is possible that future observations or theoretical developments may challenge or refine our current understanding of the role of black holes in the formation and evolution of galaxies.
